meanings.sent1: The fire will incinerate the old papers.
meanings.sent2: The firefighters had to incinerate the hazardous waste.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally incinerated my toast this morning.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat seemed to incinerate all hope.
meanings.sent5: The dragon's breath could incinerate entire villages.

meanings.definition: To destroy something by burning it
meanings.sent1: The volcanic eruption threatened to incinerate the forest.
meanings.sent2: The arsonist intended to incinerate the evidence.
meanings.sent3: She watched in horror as the microwave incinerated her popcorn.
meanings.sent4: The wildfire's flames seemed to incinerate the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The villain's plan was to incinerate all traces of his past.
